Package it.nieels.unibs.pajc.h1v3.model

Class Piece

  • java.lang.Object
    • it.nieels.unibs.pajc.h1v3.model.Piece
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Beetle, DummyPiece, Grasshopper, QueenBee, SoldierAnt
    public abstract class Piece
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    Modelization of a game piece's common characteristics, this is an abstract class, each piece type will need further implementation of its specific behavior in other designated classes.
    Author:
    Nicol Stocchetti (NieelsHub)
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class Description
      static class  Piece.PieceColor
      Each piece can be of two possible colors.
      static class  Piece.Placement
      Describes the possible positioning of a piece on a particular side of another piece.
      static class  Piece.Side
      This enum works as a mean to represent the six sides of a piece (hexagonal) by the relative direction in which they face.

      Modifier and Type Method Description
      abstract java.util.ArrayList<Piece.Placement> calcPossibleMoves()  
      boolean canMove()
      Checks if the piece is not surrounded enough and is still able to move (to be able to move the piece must not be under another piece and have at least 2 free consecutive sides).

      Checks if this piece has another piece linked to it on the specified side.

      Returns the piece on the top of this piece.

      Tells if the piece can perform vertical movements.
      void linkTo​(Piece neighbor, Piece.Side positionOnNeighbor)
      Creates a link between this piece and the other specified piece on its specified side (no controls on previously existent links, no update of the global coordinates of the pieces).
      void resetLinks()
      Removes all links with other pieces.
      void resetPositionCoords​(java.lang.Double x, java.lang.Double y)
      Sets the position coordinates to the specified arbitrary values (no controls on other pieces' coordinates or previously existent links, no update of the pieces' links).

      Puts a piece under this piece.

      Sets new position coordinates for this piece, calculated form another piece's position adding the offset of the movement from it through the specified side (no controls on previously existent links, no update of the pieces' links).

      • checkLink

        public Piece checkLink​(Piece.Side side)
        Checks if this piece has another piece linked to it on the specified side.
        Parameters:
        side - , the face on which we want to check for linked pieces, Side.
        Returns:
        the linked piece (or null if there isn't a piece linked to the chosen side), Piece.

      • canMove

        public boolean canMove()
        Checks if the piece is not surrounded enough and is still able to move (to be able to move the piece must not be under another piece and have at least 2 free consecutive sides).
        Returns:
        true if the piece can move, else false.

      • setRelativeCoordinates

        public void setRelativeCoordinates​(Piece neighbor,
                                   Piece.Side positionOnNeighbor)
        Sets new position coordinates for this piece, calculated form another piece's position adding the offset of the movement from it through the specified side (no controls on previously existent links, no update of the pieces' links).
        Parameters:
        neighbor - the piece from which to calculate the new coordinates, Piece.
        positionOnNeighbor - the side on the landmark piece from where to calculate the position offset, Side.

      • linkTo

        public void linkTo​(Piece neighbor,
                   Piece.Side positionOnNeighbor)
        Creates a link between this piece and the other specified piece on its specified side (no controls on previously existent links, no update of the global coordinates of the pieces).
        Parameters:
        neighbor - the other piece to link, Piece.
        positionOnNeighbor - the side on the new piece where to link this piece, Side.

      • resetLinks

        public void resetLinks()
        Removes all links with other pieces.

      • resetPositionCoords

        public void resetPositionCoords​(java.lang.Double x,
                                java.lang.Double y)
        Sets the position coordinates to the specified arbitrary values (no controls on other pieces' coordinates or previously existent links, no update of the pieces' links).
        Parameters:
        x - the x coordinate, Double.
        y - the y coordinate, Double.

      • copy

        public Piece copy()
